answers.text:
Hello,
I found some cities that have used surveillance cameras to monitor graffiti activity. You may want to contact them individually for more information.
Buffalo, NY
http://www.ci.buffalo.ny.us/Home/City_Departments/Citizens_Services/Anti-GraffitiAndCleanCityPrograms
Chino Hills, CA
http://www.chinohills.org/index.aspx?NID=23
Fife, WA
http://www.cityoffife.org/?p=city_departments&a=police_department&b=graffiti_solutions
Denver, CO
http://magtfdenver.org/Tips%20For%20Businesses.htm
I have also included a news article about the program which was implemented in Denver.
http://www.rockymountainnews.com/news/2007/nov/14/graffiti-cameras-on-patrol/
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Mary Jacobs
text: The City of Sierra Vista would like to know if other communities have employed cost-effective cameras that are used for monitoring areas in which grafitti appears periodically.  We invested in a camera several years ago for over $5,000 that never worked the way it was supposed to.  The vendor has not been helpful in getting it to working order.  A suggestion has been made internally to consider cameras such as those sold inexpensively via Cabellos or other mainstream vendors (around $100 apiece).  But before we do, we would be very interested to hear if other communities have successful used similar technology.  Thanks!
title: Grafitti  Cameras for Covert Monitoring
